intro: Heptapleurum alpinum, commonly known as the alpine heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
